reasoning:
STRATEGIC TRADING PLAN FOR NOVEMBER 21, 2025 - CEO DIRECTIVE

CAPITAL ALLOCATION AUTHORIZED:
- Total Deployment: Up to $14,000 (14% of capital)
- Position 1 (NVDA): $7,000 max (post-earnings momentum, AI chip demand thesis)
- Position 2 (SQ): $7,000 max ($5B buyback catalyst, fintech rotation thesis)
- Cash Reserve: $84,901 (86% dry powder maintained)

STRATEGIC THESIS:
Play AI/Fintech strength (NVDA, SQ) while avoiding Retail/EV weakness (TSLA, TGT). This is a stock-picker's market, not broad index environment. Sector selection matters more than market timing.

EXECUTION FRAMEWORK:
1. 8:00 AM - Daedalus risk assessment (approval required)
2. 8:30 AM - Stratagem setup identification (≥7/10 quality threshold)
3. 9:00 AM - CEO capital allocation decision
4. 9:45 AM - Entry window (post opening-range formation)
5. Stops: NVDA -9% ($175), SQ -12% ($76.50)
6. Profit targets: +25% for 50% position reduction

RISK MANAGEMENT:
- Max loss per position: NVDA -$630, SQ -$840
- Max portfolio loss: -$1,470 (within -$1,500 daily limit)
- No day trades (PDT constraint: 8/3, must hold overnight)
- 60-minute cooling between trades
- Stops set immediately upon fill

CONTINGENCY PLANS:
- If no ≥7/10 setups: Stand down entirely (capital preservation IS success)
- If only one setup quality: Deploy $7K only, maintain 93% cash
- If both stop out: Cease trading immediately, 10-min cooling, Daedalus review
- If market gaps significantly: Wait for stabilization, don't chase

SUCCESS METRICS:
- Process scorecard ≥6/7 (discipline over P&L)
- All parameter constraints honored
- All advisor approvals obtained
- All vetoes accepted without override
- Transaction costs <$30 (limit orders only)

STRATEGIC INTENT:
Capture alpha on high-conviction, catalyst-driven setups while maintaining institutional discipline. Not forcing trades - waiting for edge to be clear, then striking with size and conviction.

This plan balances offense (capital deployment on quality setups) with defense (86% cash reserve, tight stops, governance structure). Success = executing the plan with discipline, regardless of outcome.
